قال الله تعالى : فَأَلْقَى عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ .

كان موسى عليه السلام في الصحراء متوجهاً إلى مصر، وكانت الصحراء باردة جداً، رأى موسى من بعيد ناراً، فقال لزوجته: ابقَيْ هنا، سأذهب لأُحضر بعض النار نتدفأ بها، وأسأل عن الطريق. عندما وصل حيث رأى النار، سمع صوتاً يناديه: يا موسى. ارتعش موسى خوفاً ورهبة وقال: نعم. قال الله عز وجل: ﴿ إِنِّي أَنَا رَبُّكَ ﴾. ازداد ارتعاش موسى وقال: نعم يا رب.. قال الله عز وجل: ﴿ فَاخْلَعْ نَعْلَيْكَ إِنَّكَ بِالْوَادِ الْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى ﴾ [طه: 12]. فخلع موسى نعليه، وأخبره الله العظيم جل وعلا أنه اختاره ليخبر فرعون وقومه أن المستحق للعبادة وحده هو الله، وأن مَن يعبد إلهاً غيره فلن يُقبل منه ولسوف يعاقَب في الآخرة. وأيّده بمعجزتين تدلاّن على أنه نبيٌّ صادق، كما كلّفه سبحانه بإخراج بني إسرائيل من سجون فرعون.

تابع موسى عليه السلام طريقه إلى مصر، ودعا الله أن يشرحَ صدره ويُيسِّر أمره. دخل موسى عليه السلام إلى القصر، وتحدث مع فرعون عن عبادة الله. قال له فرعون: أنت رجل كاذب، فأنا الرب الأعلى. فألقى موسى عصاه كما علمه الله، فتحولت العصا إلى ثعبان ضخم مخيف، ومدّ يده إليها فعادت كما كانت عصا. ثم أخرج يده من جيبه فإذا لونها أبيض كالبدر، وعندما أدخلها ثانية إلى جيبه، عاد لونها الطبيعي. اغتاظ فرعون وغضب غضباً شديداً، وقال له: إنك ساحر كبير، وسأثبت لك ذلك. أمر فرعون السحرة، فتجمعوا في ساحة كبيرة، وألقَوْا حبالهم وعِصيهم التي كانوا يحركونها بخفة ومهارة فتبدو لمن يراها وكأنها ثعابين تمشي على الأرض. خاف موسى، لكنه تذكر أن الله معه وسوف ينصره، فألقى عصاه، فتحولت إلى ثعبان ضخم ابتلعٍ كل ما صنعوا!! وعرض عليهم معجزة اليد أيضاً!!

وهنا فوجئ السحرة، وقالوا: نحن سحرة ونعرف السحر جيداً، وما فعله موسى ليس سحراً أبداً. وعندها آمن به السحرة كلهم، وقالوا له: إنك صادق، وإنك نبيّ، وإن ربنا هو ربك الذي تعبده. اشتد غضب فرعون، وصار يصرخ ويقول: أنا ربكم الأعلى، كيف تعبدون إلهاً غيري؟ سأنتقم منكم! سأقطع أيديكم وأرجلكم! سأصلبكم على جذوع الأشجار وأقتلكم! لكنهم أحبوا الإيمان ودخل قلوبهم فلم يتراجعوا، ولم يخافوا منه.
number-en: The story of the snake of Moses, peace be upon him
label-en:
God Almighty said: Then he threw his staff, and behold, it was a visible snake.

Moses, peace be upon him, was in the desert, heading to Egypt. The desert was very cold. Moses saw a fire from afar, so he said to his wife: Stay here. I will go get some fire to warm ourselves with, and ask about the way. When he arrived where he saw the fire, he heard a voice calling him: O Moses. Moses trembled in fear and dread and said: Yes. God Almighty said: “Indeed, I am your Lord.” Moses' trembling increased and he said: Yes, Lord.. God Almighty said: “Then take off your sandals. Indeed, you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa” [Taha: 12]. So Moses took off his sandals, and God Almighty told him that he had chosen him to tell Pharaoh and his people that the only one worthy of worship is God, and that whoever worships a god other than Him will not be accepted from him and will be punished in the afterlife. He supported him with two miracles indicating that he was a true prophet, and God Almighty also commissioned him to release the Children of Israel from the prisons of Pharaoh.

Moses, peace be upon him, continued on his way to Egypt, and prayed to God to open his heart and facilitate his affairs. Moses, peace be upon him, entered the palace and spoke to Pharaoh about worshiping God. Pharaoh said to him: You are a lying man, for I am the Most High Lord. So Moses threw his staff as God had taught him, and the staff turned into a huge, frightening snake. He extended his hand to it and it returned to being a staff. Then he took his hand out of his pocket and saw that it was white like the full moon. When he put it back into his pocket, its normal color returned. Pharaoh became angry and very angry, and said to him: You are a great magician, and I will prove it to you. Pharaoh ordered the magicians to gather in a large square and drop their ropes and sticks, which they moved lightly and skillfully, making them appear to those who saw them as if they were snakes walking on the ground. Moses was afraid, but he remembered that God was with him and would help him, so he threw his staff, and it turned into a huge snake that swallowed everything they had made!! He also showed them the miracle of the hand!!

Here the magicians were surprised and said: We are magicians and we know magic well, and what Moses did is not magic at all. Then all the magicians believed in him and said to him: You are telling the truth, you are a prophet, and our Lord is your Lord whom you worship. Pharaoh's anger increased, and he started screaming and saying: I am your Lord, the Most High. How can you worship a god other than me? I will take revenge on you! I will cut off your hands and feet! I will crucify you on a log and kill you! But they loved faith and it entered their hearts, so they did not back down, nor were they afraid of it.

قال الله تعالى : ( وإذا قال موسى لقومه إن الله يأمركم أن تذبحوا بقرة قالوا أتتخذنا هزوا قال أعوذ بالله أن أكون من الجهلين ( 67 ) قالوا ادع لنا ربك يبن لنا ما هى قال أنه يقول إنها بقرة لا فارض ولا بكر عوان بين ذلك فافعلوا ما تؤمرون ( 68 ) قالوا ادع لنا ربك يبن لنا ما لونها قال إنه يقول إنها بقرة صفراء فاقع لونها تسر النظرين ( 69 ) قالوا ادع لنا ربك يبين لنا ما هى إن البقر تشبه علينا وإنا إن شاء الله لمهتدون ( 70 ) قال إنه يقول إنها بقرة لا ذلول تثير الأرض ولا تسقى الحرث مسلمة لا تشبه فيها قالوا الئن جئت بالحق فذبحوها وما كادوا يفعلون ( 71 ) وإذ قتلتم نفسا فادرءتم فيها والله مخرج ما كنتم تكتمون ( 72 ) فقلنا اضربوه ببعضها كذلك يحى الله الموتى ويريكم ايته لعلكم تعقلون ) .

كان فى بنى إسرائيل شاب فقير فى كل شئ ... فى المال وفقير فى الأخلاق ليس عنده دين ولا أمانة . وكان له عم غنى كثير المال وكانت له ابنة جميلة جدا . فكان هذا الشاب يتمنى موت عمه فى أقرب وقت من أجل أن يرث المال الكثير ويتزوج ابنة عمه الجميلة . ولكن عنه عاش طويلا وكان فى غاية الصحة والعافية . فتجعل هذا الشاب موت عمه من أجل أن يستمتع بالمال . وأخذ هذا الشاب يدبر تلك المؤامرة الحقيرة لقتل عمه ... إلى أن استطاع فى ليلة من الليالى أن يقتل عمه ... وحتى لا يعرف الناس أنه هو الذى قتل عمه ، أخذ جثة عمه وألقاها أمام بيت أحد أقاربه وجلس يبكى على باب البيت وكأنه حزين على موته . فلما مر الناس عليه وجدوه يبكى ويتهم أهل هذا البيت بقتل عمه . فخرج أصحاب البيت وأقسموا أنهم لم يقتلوه . وضاع الحق بين الناس ولم يعرفوا من القاتل !!! وذهبوا إلى نبى الله موسى عليه السلام وأخبروه بخبر هذا الرجل المقتول . فقام وقال لهم : أسألكم بالله من الذى يعلم قاتل هذا الرجل ؟ ... فلم يرد أحد فقال له رجل منهم : يا بنى الله لماذا لا تسأل ربك حتى يخبرك بخبر القاتل . فسأل موسى ربه ( جل وعلا ) فأوحى إليه بأن يأمرهم أن يذبحوا بقرة . فتعجب الناس من ذلك وظنوا أن موسى عليه السلام يستهزئ بهم . فقال لهم موسى عليه السلام : ( قال أعوذ بالله أن أكون من الجهلين ) : أى أعوذ بالله أن أخبركم بشئ من أوامر الله فلقد أخبرتكم بما أمر الله .

ولقد كان يكفيهم أن يذبحوا أى بقرة ؛ لأن الله ( جل وعلا ) لم يحدد لهم أى مواصفات لتلك البقرة ولكن شددوا فشدد الله عليهم . فسألوا عن سنها فأخبرهم بأنها متوسطة العمر لا كبيرة ولا صغيرة وأمرهم أن ينفذوا أمر الله ( جل وعلا ) دون أى تأخير لكن بنى إسرائيل كانوا لا يطيعون الأوامر بل كانوا يتهربون ويتحايلون على تلك الأوام بأدنى الحيل حتى لا ينفذوها ... وكانوا يكثرون من الأسئلة بقصد التهرب من الأوامر وتضييع الوقت . فسألوا نبى الله موسى عليه السلام : ما لونها ؟ فأجابهم بأنها بقرة صفراء فاقع لونها – أى شديدة الصفرة – جميلة المنظر .. تسر من النظر إليها من شدة حسنها وبهائها . ثم شددوا أيضا : (قَالُوا ادْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُبَيِّنْ لَنَا مَا هِيَ إِنَّ الْبَقَرَ تَشَابَهَ عَلَيْنَا وَإِنَّا إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ لَمُهْتَدُونَ (70) قَالَ إِنَّهُ يَقُولُ إِنَّهَا بَقَرَةٌ لَا ذَلُولٌ تُثِيرُ الْأَرْضَ وَلَا تَسْقِي الْحَرْثَ مُسَلَّمَةٌ لَا شِيَةَ فِيهَا) . فأخبرهم بأنها بقرة ليست مذللة أو معدة للحرث ولا لسقى الأرض بالساقية ... سالمة من العيوب ليس فيها أى لون يخالف لونها فهى صفراء خالصة الصفراء . فلما حددها بهذه الصفات : (قَالُوا الْآَنَ جِئْتَ بِالْحَقِّ فَذَبَحُوهَا وَمَا كَادُوا يَفْعَلُونَ 71) .

أخذوا تلك المواصفات من موسى عليه السلام ، وراحوا يبحثون عن بقرة تتصف بها . بحثوا عن بنى إسرائيل ، فلم يجدوا إلا بقرة واحدة فقط تتصف بهذه الصفات ... كانت تلك البقرة لشاب يتيم فقير كان بارا بأبيه الذى مات ، وبارا بأمه التى ما زالت تعيش. فساومهم وبقى يساومهم ، ويرفع سعرها تدريجيا ، وهم يراجعونه ويساومونه ... رفع سعرها من مائة دينار ، إلى مائتين . ثم إلى أربعمائة . ثم ثمانمائة . ثم طلب منهم أن يضعوها فى الميزان ، وأن يدفعوا له ثمنها بما يساوى وزنها ذهبا ! فأضطروا إلى الموافقة لعدم وجود بقرة غيرها . ودفعوا للشاب ما طلبه ، فصار من كبار الأغنياء لبره بوالديه . أخذوا البقرة وذبحوها ، ثم أخذوا جزءا منها ، وضربوا بها جسد القتيل . فأحيا الله القتيل فنظر حوله فوجد أناسا كثيرين فسأله أحدهم : من الذى قتلك ؟ فقال : قتلنى ابن أخى طمعا فى ثروتى .. ثم مات القتيل مرة أخرى . فألقى القبض على القاتل وحرم من الميراث عقوبة له على جريمته ... ومنذ ذلك اليوم لم يورث قاتل من الميراث المقتول . قال الله تعالى : ( كذلك يحى الله الموتى ويريكم ايته لعلكم تعقلون73) . أى : كما شاهدتهم إحياء هذا القتيل عن أمر الله له ... كذلك أمره فى سائر الموتى ، إذا شاء إحياهم أحياهم فى ساعة واحدة .

وعلى الرغم من إعجاب ودهشة بنى إسرائيل لما حصل من موسى عليه السلام فإنهم ظلوا على عنادهم وبقيت قلوبهم على قساوتها كأنها الحجارة أو أشد قسوة منها . ولقد لقى موسى عليه السلام من (( بنى إسرائيل )) – كما لقى غيره من أنبيائهم – كل عنت وعناد وصدود ، وما يزالون إلى اليوم يتصفون بالنفاق والغدر والمكر ، ويخالفون شريعة الله وأوامره التى أنزلها فى (( التوراة )) ؛ ولقد تجرؤوا على كتاب الله فغيروا وأخفوا كل دعوة فيه إلى الفضيلة والأخلاق !
number-en: The story of the cow of the children of Israel
label-en:
God Almighty said: (And when Moses said to his people, “Indeed, God commands you to slaughter a cow.” They said, “Do you take us as a mockery?” He said, “I seek refuge in God lest I be among the ignorant.” (67) They said, “Call upon your Lord to explain for us what she is.” He said, “He says that she is a cow, neither mature nor young, indifferent.” So do as you are commanded. (68) They said, “Call upon your Lord to explain to us what color she is.” He said, “He says that she is a yellow cow, with a bright color.” (69) They said, “Call upon your Lord for us to make clear to us what she is. Indeed, cows resemble us, and we, God willing, will be guided.” (70) He said, “He says that she is a cow, neither tamed to plow the earth nor to irrigate the field, submissive, with no resemblance to her.” They said: If you bring the truth, they slaughtered it, but they were not nearly able to do it. (71) And when you killed a soul and then rebuked therein, and God will bring forth what you were concealing. (72) Then We said, “Strike him with some of it.” Thus God revives the dead and shows you His signs that you may understand.

There was a young man among the children of Israel who was poor in everything...in money and poor in morals. He had no religion or trustworthiness. He had a rich uncle who had a lot of money and had a very beautiful daughter. This young man wished for his uncle to die as soon as possible so that he could inherit a lot of money and marry his cousin’s beautiful daughter. But he lived a long time and was in very good health. So this young man makes his uncle's death in order for him to enjoy the money. This young man began to plot this despicable plot to kill his uncle... until one night he was able to kill his uncle... and so that people would not know that he was the one who killed his uncle, he took his uncle’s body and threw it in front of one of his relatives’ house and sat crying at the door of the house as if he was sad about his death. When people passed by him, they found him crying and accusing the people of this house of killing his uncle. The owners of the house came out and swore that they had not killed him. The truth was lost among the people and they did not know who the killer was!!! They went to the Prophet of God, Moses, peace be upon him, and told him the news of this murdered man. So he stood up and said to them: I ask you by God, who knows who killed this man? ...No one responded, and one of them said to him: O children of God, why do you not ask your Lord until he tells you the news of the killer? So Moses asked his Lord (Glory be to Him) and He inspired him to command them to slaughter a cow. The people were amazed at this and thought that Moses, peace be upon him, was mocking them. Moses, peace be upon him, said to them: (He said, “I seek refuge in God lest I be among the ignorant”): That is, I seek refuge in God to tell you something of God’s commands, for I have told you what God has commanded.

It was enough for them to slaughter any cow. Because God (Glory be to Him) did not specify for them any specifications for that cow, but they were strict, so God made them strict. So they asked about her age, so he told them that she was middle-aged, neither old nor young, and he ordered them to carry out the command of God (Almighty and Majestic) without any delay, but the children of Israel were not obeying the orders, but rather they were evading and circumventing those orders with the slightest tricks so as not to carry them out... They asked a lot of questions with the intention of evading orders and wasting time. So they asked the Prophet of God, Moses, peace be upon him: What color is it? He replied to them that it was a bright yellow cow - that is, very yellow - beautiful in appearance. It was pleasing to look at due to the intensity of its beauty and splendor. Then they also stressed: (They said, “Call upon your Lord for us to explain to us what they are. Indeed, cows have become equal to us, and indeed, if God wills, we will be guided.” (70) He said that he says that they are A cow neither tamed to plow the earth nor to irrigate the field, free from blemish, without blemish on her.) . So he told them that she is a cow that is not humiliated or prepared for plowing or for irrigating the earth with a waterwheel... It is free of defects and does not have any color that is different from its color, so it is pure yellow. When he specified it with these characteristics: (They said, “Now you have brought the truth.” So they slaughtered it, but they were hardly able to do so. 71)

They took these characteristics from Moses, peace be upon him, and began searching for a cow that would be characterized by them. They searched for the children of Israel, but they found only one cow that had these qualities... That cow belonged to a poor orphan young man who was kind to his father, who had died, and he was kind to his mother, who was still living. So he bargained with them and continued to bargain with them, gradually raising its price, while they reviewed it and bargained with him... He raised its price from one hundred dinars, to two hundred. Then to four hundred. Then eight hundred. Then he asked them to put it on the scale and pay him its price equal to its weight in gold! They were forced to agree because there was no other cow. They paid the young man what he asked for, and he became one of the richest people out of respect for his parents. They took the cow and slaughtered it, then took part of it and hit the dead man's body with it. So God revived the dead man, and he looked around and found many people. One of them asked him: Who killed you? He said: My nephew killed me out of greed for my wealth... Then the dead man died again. So the murderer was arrested and deprived of the inheritance as a punishment for his crime... Since that day, no murderer has inherited from the murdered person’s inheritance. God Almighty said: (Thus does God give life to the dead and show you His signs that you may understand.73) That is: as I witnessed them resurrecting this dead man according to God’s command for him... This is His command regarding all the dead: if He wishes to revive them, He revives them in one hour.

Despite the children of Israel’s admiration and astonishment at what happened to Moses, peace be upon him, they remained stubborn and their hearts remained as hard as stones, or even harder than stones. Moses, peace be upon him, faced the children of Israel - as did other of their prophets - with all stubbornness, obstinacy, and stubbornness, and to this day they are still characterized by hypocrisy, treachery, and deception, and they violate the law of God and His commands that He revealed in the Torah. They dared to criticize the Book of God, changing and concealing every call to virtue and morals in it!

قال الله تعالى : سَيَقُولُونَ ثَلَاثَةٌ رَّابِعُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ وَيَقُولُونَ خَمْسَةٌ سَادِسُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ رَجْمًا بِالْغَيْبِ ۖ وَيَقُولُونَ سَبْعَةٌ وَثَامِنُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ ۚ قُل رَّبِّي أَعْلَمُ بِعِدَّتِهِم مَّا يَعْلَمُهُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلٌ ۗ فَلَا تُمَارِ فِيهِمْ إِلَّا مِرَاءً ظَاهِرًا وَلَا تَسْتَفْتِ فِيهِم مِّنْهُمْ أَحَدًا (22)

بعد ليل طويل أشرقت الشمس من جديد ليبدأ يوم جديد في حياة أهل الكهف تلك المدينه التي تسمي (أفسوس) وبدأت الكائنات تستيقظ من نومها وسباتها وأخذ ت الطيور تنتقل بين الاغصان بأصواتها البديعة وبدأت أنفاس الحياة تدب علي الأرض وراح الكون كله يسبح بحمد الله (عز وجل) إلا أهل هذه المدينة ال ين كانو يكفرون بالله عز وجل فقد كان أهل هذه المدينة يكفرون بالله ويعبدون الأصنام ولأوثان ويسجدون لها من دون الله (جل وعلا) على الرغم من تلك النعم العظيمة التى أسبغها الله عليهم وتلك الحضارة التي وصلوا إليها ومع لك فقد تركو عبادة الله عزوجل وذهبوا يسجدون لأحجار لا تنفع ولاتضر

وكان حاكم هذه المدينة رجلآ ظالمآ وكافرآ اسمه (دقيانوس) فقد كان يأمر الناس بعبادة الأصنام وبأن يذبحوا ويقدمو القرابين لتلك الأصنام وكان إذ رأى أحدآ يعبد الله (جل وعلا) ولا يعبد الأصنام يعذبه عزاباً شديداً لدرجة أنة كان إزا رأى رجلاً مؤمناً كات يضعه في السجن ويطلق عليه أسداً جائعا ليأكله وفى يوم من الأيام خرج أهل هذه المدينة إلي عيد من أعيادهم فخرجو هؤلاء الفتية معهم ونظروا إلى قومهم وهم يسجدون ويذبحون للأصنام فألقى الله نور الإيمان في قلوب هؤلاء الشباب وكانوا سادة القوم فتركو قومهم في هذا العيد واعتزلوهم فذهب أول واحد منهم وجلس بعيداً تحت ظل شجرة ثم أتي إليه الثاني فالثالث إلي أن اجتمع السبعة وكان كل واحد منهم يكتم إيمانه خوفآ من أصحابه حتى لا يخبر احدهم الملك الظالم فيجعله طعامآ للأسد وفجأة قام واحدً منهم وقال تعلمون والله ما أخرجكم من قومكم على هذا المكان إلا شئ في صدوركم فتعالو نتصارح فيما بيننا

ثم قال اما أنا فإننى أري ان قومنا على الباطل فهم يصنعون تلك التماثيل بأيديهم ثم يسجدون لها من دون الله وهى التى لا تسمع ولا تبصر ولا تنفع ولا تضرفكيف يسجدون لتلك الأصنام ولا يسجدون لله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض ورفع السماء بغير عمد فجعل فيها الشمس والقمر وزينها بالنجوم فقال الثانى صدقت ياأخي فلقد خطر ببالي كل ذلك وقلت في نفس أليس الله (جل وعلا) الذي خلق البحار والأنهار والجبال والأشجار وأنعم علينا بكل هذه النعم هو الذي يستحق أن نعبده وحده وقال الثالث صدقتما كيف نعبد أصناماً من دون الله الذي خلق الكائنات كلها وأبدع خلقها وسخر الكون كله لنا ثم نعبد غيره لايكون أبدآ وتكلم الباقون مثل كلامهم ثم قالوا جميعاً ( رَبُّنَا رَبُّ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ لَنْ نَدْعُوَاْ مِنْ دُونِهِ إِلَهًا لَقَدْ قُلْنَا إِذًا شَطَطًا)

فتصارحوا وأعلنوا إيمانهم فيما بينهم وصاروا يداً واحدة وأصبحوا إخواناً متحابين في الله (جل وعلا) واتخذوا لأنفسهم معبداً يعبدون الله فيه بعيداً عن قومهم وظل كل واحد يخوض فيما يخوض فيه القوم ويضطرب فيما يضطرب فيه الناس حتى إذا ما خلا بنفسه واجتمع مع قلبه اتجه إلى الله عابداً مصلياً ومنزهاً ومقدساً ولكن بعد فترة يسيرة عرف قومهم أنهم آمنوا بالله (جل وعلا) فأخبروا هذا الملك الظالم. فلما علم الملك بإيمان هؤلاء الشباب أرسل إليهم فجاءوا إليه وهم يخشون أن يفعل بهم كما فعل بمن سبقهم للإيمان بأن جعلهم طعاماً للأسود ولكن الله ثبتهم وربط على قلوبهم فقالوا كلمه الحق أمام هذا الحاكم الظالم ودعوه إلى الله (جل وعلا)

فتعالو بنا لنري ماذا صنع معهم هذا الملك الظالم الذي يعبد الأصنام من دون الله (جلا وعلا) قال لهم الملك لقد علمت أنكم صبأتم وتركتم دين الأباء ولأجداد ودخلتم في دين أخر ولو كنتم من عامة الشعب لتركتكم وشأنكم ولكنكم من أشرف القوم ولو علم الناس بدينكم لتبعوكم ودخلوا في دينكم وفي ذلك إفساد لتلك المملكة وضياع لملكي واعلموا أني لن أتعجل في عذابكم بل سأترككم لتفكروا في شأنكم وتراجعوا أنفسكم فإما أن ترجعوا إلى ديننا وإما أن أمزق أجسادكم إلي أشلاء لتكونوا عبره للناس من حولكم فربط الله علي قلوبهم وثبتهم فقالوا أيها الملك إن هذا الدين لم ندخل فية مقلدين ولامكرهين بل دعتنا إليه الفطرة السليمة التى جعلها الله فى قلوبنا ولن نعد إلا الله الذى خلق السموات ةالأرض وأسبغ علينا نعمه ظاهرة وباطنة وأما قومنا فقد عبدوا تلك الأصنام تقليداً للأباء من غير حجة ولا برهان وإناندعوك أيها الملك إلي عبادة الله الواحد القهار ليجمع الله لك الله سعاده الدنيا ولآخرة فإن كنت لا تريد فإن عذاب الدنيا أهون من عذاب الاخرة فغضب عليهم الملك وأمر بنزع لباس الزينة عنهم الذي كان عليهم من زينة قومهم وهددهم إن لم يعودوا إلى دين قومهم ثم أجلهم لينظروا في امرهم لعلهم يرجعون وكان هذا من لطف الله بهم لأنهم توصلوا بهذا التأجيل إلى الهرب والفرار بدينهم من الفتنة .

فكر أولئك الفتية المؤمنون في الخطوة التالية فوجدوها فى العزلة فقرروا اعتزال قومهم إنهم مؤمنون وقومهم كافرون ولامجال لآن يعيشوا معهم خرجوا من المدينة غلي الجبال وقرروا أن يأوا إلى كهف فى جبل وكان معهم نقود قد نقش عليها اسم هذا الملك الظالم الذى هدهم بالقتل إن لم يرجعوا عن دينهم ودخلوا الكهف ولم يدخل معم الكلب لأنه نجس وقد يلمس ثيابهم أو أبدنهم فينجسها فقرورا أن يجعلوه حارساً على باب الكهف فيحرسهم من اللصوص ومن اتباع الملك وجنوده إذا جاؤوا بحثاً عنهم وليدافع عنهم إذا جائتهم حية أو ثعبان أو اسد او غير ذلك وهم يعلمون أن الكلب يضرب بة المثل فى الوفاء فهو لا يتخلى أبداً عن خدمة صاحبه وحراسته والدفاع عنه حتى لو كانت حياته فداء لصاحبه أما هؤ لاء الشباب المؤمنون فقد دخلوا الكهف وقالو( رَبَّنَا آَتِنَا مِنْ لَدُنْكَ رَحْمَةً وَهَيِّئْ لَنَا مِنْ أَمْرِنَا رَشَدًا )

وكانت الرحلة من (أفسوس)إلى الكهف طويلة فشعروا بالتعب الشديد وناموا على الأرض لينلوا قسطاً من الراحة بعد رحلة الفرار إلى الله (جل وعلا) وطلبوا من الله ان ينشر عليهم فى الكهف من رحمته واستجاب الله لهم فكانت رحمة الله عليهم فى الكهف حيث يسرالله لهم الأمر وسخرلهم الأيات فأمر الشمس أن لاتمس أجسادهم حتى لا تؤذيها كانت عند الصباح تميل عن أجسادهم فلاتقع عليهم وكانت عند الغروب تميل عنها كذالك فلا تأتيها وكانوا فى فجوة وسط الكهف ومعنى هذا أن الشمس كانت تدخل الكهف فتقضى على الجراثيم والميكروبات وتغير ذلك الهواء حتى لا يفسد ولاتتسلط أشعتها عليهم مباشرة حتى لا تحترق أجسادهم ولا ملابسهم وإنما ينتفعون بحرارتها وأشعتها ودفئهادون اى ضرر ومن أيات الله عليهم فى الكهف أن عيونهم كانت مفتوحة فكان من ينظر إليهم يحسبهم أيقاظاً ينظرون إليه مع أنهم نيام راقدون

وحتى لا تأكل الأرض أجسادهم كان الله يقلبهم مرة على اليمين ومر على اليسار وكان معهم كلبهم الذى صحبهم حيث جلس على عتبة باب الكهف وبسط ذراعيه ونام مثل نومتهم وحتى لا يعتدى عليهم أحد وهم رقود قذف الله فى قلب كل من ينظر إليهم الرعب بحيث لو اطلع عليهم لولى منهم فرارا ولملئ منهم رعبآ قال تعالى (وَتَحْسَبُهُمْ أَيْقَاظًا وَهُمْ رُقُودٌ وَنُقَلِّبُهُمْ ذَاتَ الْيَمِينِ وَذَاتَ الشِّمَالِ وَكَلْبُهُمْ بَاسِطٌ ذِرَاعَيْهِ بِالْوَصِيدِ لَوِ اطَّلَعْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ لَوَلَّيْتَ مِنْهُمْ فِرَارًا وَلَمُلِئْتَ مِنْهُمْ رُعْبًا ) وكان الفتيه قد ناموا تلك السنوات الطويلة دون طعام ولا شراب ومع ذلك لم يموتوا ولم يشعر أحد منهم بجوع أو عطش وكل ذلك بقدره الله (جل وعلا.

وتعاقبت الأيام ومضت الأعوام وبعد هذا الزمان الطويل بعثهم الله عزوجل من نومهم وقد تغيركل شئ فى هذا الكون لقد بعثهم الله من نومهم فقاموا من نومهم وهم يشعرون بتعب شديد فى أجسادهم وأخذوا يتسألون فيما بينهم عن المدة التى أقاموها فى الكهف قال تعالى (قَالَ قَائِلٌ مِنْهُمْ كَمْ لَبِثْتُمْ قَالُوا لَبِثْنَا يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍ قَالُوا رَبُّكُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا لَبِثْتُمْ) ظانين أن الزمن لم يمض بهم وأن عجلة التاريخ واقفة عند كهفهم قال واحد :منهم يسأل يخيل إلى أن ساعات طويلة رقدنها فما تظنون يا رفاق قال الثاني:ربما نكون قد لبثنا يوماً فإن هذا الجوع الذى نحسه والتعب الذى نشعر به ليؤذن بما أذن وقال الثالث: نحن قد رقدنا فى الصباح وهذه الشمس لم تغرب فما أظن إلا أننا قد لبثنا بعضاّ من من يوم وقال الرابع: دعونا من تساؤلكم فالله أعلم بما لبثتم ولكننى أحس جوعاً شديداً وكأنى لم أطعم منذ ليال فليذهب واحد منكم إلى المدينة يلتنس لنا طعاماّ ولكن عليه أن يكون حذراً حتى لا يعرفه أحد فإنهم لو عرفوه وعرفوا مكننا فسوف يقتلوننا أو يفتنونا عن ديننا

(فَابْعَثُوا أَحَدَكُمْ بِوَرِقِكُمْ هَذِهِ إِلَى الْمَدِينَةِ فَلْيَنْظُرْ أَيُّهَا أَزْكَى طَعَامًا فَلْيَأْتِكُمْ بِرِزْقٍ مِنْهُ وَلْيَتَلَطَّفْ وَلَا يُشْعِرَنَّ بِكُمْ أَحَدًا (19) إِنَّهُمْ إِنْ يَظْهَرُوا عَلَيْكُمْ يَرْجُمُوكُمْ أَوْ يُعِيدُوكُمْ فِي مِلَّتِهِمْ وَلَنْ تُفْلِحُوا إِذًا أَبَدًا ) فخرج واحد منهم باحثاً عن الطعام وفى يديه تلك العملات الفضية التى نقش عليها صورة ذلك الملك الظالم الذى كان يعيش فى تلك المدينة ويحكمها منذ أكثر من ثلاثمائة عام فلما مشى فى طرقات المدينة وجد أن المدينة قد تغيرت معالمها كلها فالناس ليسوا هم الناس والطرقات ليست هى الطرقات التى يعرفها والبيوت غير البيوت هذه خرائب أصبحت قصوراً وتلك قصور أمست خرائب وأطلالاً وتلك وجوه لم يعرفها وصور لم يألفها أما الديار فإنها كديارهم ورأى رجال الحى غير رجاله أخذ يفكر فى نفسه هل ذهبنا إلى بلاد أخرى ونحن نأئمون أم دارت الأرض من تحتنا ونحن لا نشعر تحيرت نظراته وكثرت لفتاته وظهر عليه الاضطراب والحيرة حتى بدأ الناس ينظرون إليه فى دهشة واستغراب.

قال له أحدهم : أغريب أنت عن هذه البلد ؟ وفيم تتأمل ؟ وعلام تبحث؟ قال: لست غريباً ولكننى أبحث عن طعام أشتريه فلا أرى مكان بيعه وأخذ الرجل بيده حتى انتهى به إلى مطعم وطلب من البائع طعاماً فنظر إليه البائع متعجباً لمنظره فلما جهز له الطعام وطلب منه ثمن الطعام أعطاه الشاب تلك النقود التى كان عليها صورة دقيانوس :فتعجب البائع وقال له من أين لك هذا المال؟ فقال الشاب: إنه المال الذى نتعامل به وهذة صورة دقيانوس فقال البائع: هل أنت مجنون إن دقيانوس –عليه لعنة الله- مات منذ أكثر من ثلاثمائة سنة فتعجب الشاب وهو يسمع هذا الكلام وأحس بأن الدماء الدماء قد تجمدت فى عرقه فتجمع الناس حول هذا الشاب وبدأ الناس يسألونه: هل عثرت على كنز أيها الفتى؟ إنها عملة قديمة قد مر عليها أكثر من ثلاثمائة سنة أحس الشاب بأن الدماء قد توقفت فى عروقه وقال لهم:يا قوم ليس الأمر كما تظنون وليست هذه النقود كنزاّ حصلت عليه وإنما هى نقود أخذتها من والدى أمس اريد أن أشترى بها طعاماً اليوم فما الذى يدعوكم إلى الدهشة؟

ثم هم بالعودة خشية أن يفضح أمره أو تظهر حقيقة حاله ولكنهم عادوا فرافقو به وتلطفو ا معه ف القول وحاوروه فى الحديث وما كان أشد ذهولهم حينما علموا أنه أحد الفتية الأشراف الذين هرابو من ثلاثمائة وتسع سنة من ملكهم الجائر الكافر وأنهم هم الذين طلبهم الملك فلم يظفر بهم ونشدهم فلم يهتد إليهم وما كان أشد خوف الشاب حينما علم أنهم فطنوا لأمره وعرفوا قصته فخاف على نفسه وإخوته وهم بالهروب قال لهم أحدهم:لا تخف يا هذا إن الملك الذى تخافه قد مات من نحو ثلاثمائة عام وإن الملك الذي يجلس الأن مؤمن بالله كما تؤمنون وأخذوه غلى ملكهم فساله عن شأنه فأخبره بأمره وهو متحير فى حاله وما هو فيه فقام ملك البلد وأهلها حتى أنتهى بهم إلى الكهف فقال لهم: دعونى أتقدمكم فى الدخول لأعلم أصحابى فدخل فيقال: إنهم لا يدرون كيف ذهب فيه وأخفى الله خبرهم ويقال:بل دخلوا عليهم ورأوهم وسلم عليهم الملك واعتنقهم وكان مسلماً فيما قيل ففرحوا به أنسوه بالكلام ثم ودعوه وسلموا عليه وعادوا إلى مضاجعهم وتوفاهم الله عز وجل فاختلفوا فيهم وتنازعوا بينهم أمرهم ماذا يفعلون بهم؟فمنهم من قال:ابنوا عليهم بنياناً ربهم أعلم بهم ولكن الحاكمين فيهم قرروا أن يبنوا عليهم مسجداً وهكذا كان حيث تم بناء المسجد عليهم وهذا خطً كبير لأن النبى صلى الله عليه وسلم نهى عن اتخاذ القبور مساجد يصلى فيها إلا أن أعظم الدروس فيى هذة القصة الجميلة أن ذلك الكلب الذى أحب هؤلاء الشباب المؤمن وصحبهم قد سعد بصحبتهم حتى ذكره الله عز وجل فى كتابه . فإن كان ذلك الكلب قد سعد بصحة أهل الإيمان ألا يحرص أحدنا على صحبة أهل الإيمان والتوحيد ليسعد فى الدنيا والأخرة
number-en: The story of the dog of the cave owners
label-en:
God Almighty said: They will say: There are three, the fourth of them is their dog, and they will say: There are five, the sixth of them is their dog, stoning unseen. And they will say: Seven and the eighth of them. (22) After a long night, the sun rose again to begin a new day in the life of the people of the cave, that city called (Ephesus). The creatures began to wake up from their sleep and slumber, and the birds began to move between the branches with their wonderful voices, and the breath of life began to spread on the earth, and the entire universe began to praise God (Almighty and Majestic), except for the people of this city who disbelieved in God Almighty. The people of this city disbelieved in God and worshiped idols and idols. And they prostrate to it instead of God (Glory be to Him) despite the great blessings that God bestowed on them and the civilization they have reached, and with you, He has abandoned And worshiping God Almighty, they went and prostrated to stones that were neither beneficial nor harmful

The ruler of this city was an unjust and infidel man named (Deqianus). He used to order people to worship idols and to sacrifice and offer sacrifices to those idols. When he saw someone worshiping God (Glory be to Him) and not worshiping idols, he would torture him celibately so severely that if he saw a believing man, he would put him in prison and release him into a hungry lion to eat him. One day, the people of this city went out to one of their holidays, so they went out. The young men were with them and they looked at their people as they prostrated and sacrificed to idols, so God cast the light of faith into his hearts. These young men were the masters of the people, so they left their people on this holiday and separated from them. The first one of them went and sat far away under the shade of a tree, then the second came to him, then the third, until the seven gathered, and each one of them concealed his faith for fear of his companions so that none of them would tell the unjust king and make him food for the lion. Suddenly one of them got up and said, “You know, by God, nothing brought you out of your people to this place except something in your chests, so come and let us be frank among ourselves.” Then he said, “As for me, I see that our people are upon falsehood. They make those statues with their own hands and then prostrate to them instead of God, and they are the ones that do not hear, see, do not benefit, or do anything. How can they prostrate to those idols and not prostrate to God, who created the heavens and the earth and raised the sky without pillars and placed in it the sun and the moon and decorated it with stars. The second said, “You have spoken the truth, my brother.” All of that came to my mind and I said to myself, “Is it not God (Glory be to Him) who created?” The seas, rivers, mountains, and trees, and He bestowed upon us all these blessings. He is the One who deserves that we worship Him alone. The third said, “You are right. How can we worship idols other than God, who created God?” To all beings, and He created their creation, and He subjected the entire universe to us, then we worship someone other than Him that will never exist, and the rest of them spoke like their words, then they all said (Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We will never call upon a god besides Him. Indeed, we said it in error.)

So they became frank and declared their faith among themselves, and they became one hand and became brothers loving each other for the sake of God (may He be glorified and exalted) and they took for themselves a temple in which they worshiped God far away from their people, and each one continued to engage in what the people were delving into and was troubled by what the people were troubled by, until when he was alone with himself and united with his heart, he turned to God as a worshiper and prayer. It was pure and holy, but after a short period their people knew that they believed in God (Glory be to Him), so they informed this unjust king. When the king learned of the faith of these young men, he sent for them, and they came to him, fearing that he would do to them what he had done to those who had come before them in the faith by making them food for the lions, but God strengthened them and tied their hearts, so they spoke to him of the truth before this unjust ruler and called him to God (Glory be to Him). So come with us and let us see what this unjust king who worships idols instead of God (Glory be to Him) has done to them. The king said to them, “I know that you have grown up and abandoned the religion of your fathers and grandfathers and entered into another religion. If you were among the common people, I would have left you alone, but you are among the most honorable people. If the people knew of your religion, they would follow you and enter into your religion, and that would be corruption of that kingdom and loss of my kingdom. And know that I will not hasten your punishment, but rather I will leave you to think about it.” Your business and withdraw from yourselves. Either you return to our religion, or I will tear your bodies into pieces so that you may be an example for the people around you. So God strengthened their hearts and strengthened them, so he said. Oh, O King, we did not enter into this religion as imitators or under compulsion, but rather the common sense that God placed in our hearts called us to it. We will no longer be considered anyone but God, who created the heavens and the earth and bestowed upon us His blessings, apparent and hidden. As for our people, they worshiped those idols in imitation of the forefathers without proof or proof. And we call upon you, O King, to worship the One and Subdued God, so that God may gather for you the happiness of this world and the hereafter. If you do not want, then the torment of this world is easier. From the torment of the afterlife, the king became angry with them and ordered the removal of the ornamental clothing that was on them from the adornment of their people, and threatened them if they did not return to the religion of their people. He gave them a deadline to look into their matter, perhaps they might return, and this was God’s kindness to them, because by this postponement they achieved escape and escape with their religion from temptation.

Those young believers thought about the next step and found it in isolation, so they decided to isolate themselves from their people. They are believers and their people are unbelievers, and there is no room for them to live with them. They left the city and climbed the mountains and decided to go to a cave in a mountain. They had with them money on which was engraved the name of this unjust king, who threatened to kill them if they did not return from their religion and entered the cave. The dog’s jaw did not enter because it was unclean, and it might touch their clothes or their body and make it unclean. To make it hot He walked to the door of the cave, guarding them from thieves and from the king’s followers and soldiers if they came looking for them, and to defend them if a snake, snake, lion, or anything else came upon them. They knew that the dog was a proverb for loyalty, as it never gave up serving its owner, guarding him, and defending him, even if his life was a sacrifice for his owner. As for these young believers, they entered the cave and said, “Our Lord, give us You have mercy, and prepare for us guidance in our affairs.) The journey from (Ephesus) to the cave was long, so they felt very tired and slept on the ground to get some rest after the journey of fleeing to God (Almighty and Majestic). They asked God to spread His mercy upon them in the cave, and God responded to them, so God’s mercy was upon them in the cave, where God made the matter easy for them and subjected them to signs. He commanded the sun not to touch their bodies so as not to harm them. In the morning, it tilted away from their bodies so it did not fall on them, and at sunset it tilted away from them so it did not reach them. They were in a gap in the middle of the cave, and this means that the sun was entering the cave and eliminating germs and microbes and changing that Air so that it does not spoil, and its rays do not shine directly on them so that their bodies and clothes do not burn, but rather they benefit from its heat, rays, and warmth without any harm. Among the signs of God upon them in the cave is that their eyes were open, so whoever looked at them thought they were awake, looking at Him even though they were asleep.

And so that the earth would not devour their bodies, God used to turn them once to the right and then to the left. They had with them their dog who accompanied them, as he sat on the doorstep of the cave, spread out his arms, and slept like theirs, and so that no one would attack them while they were lying. God cast terror into the hearts of everyone who looked at them, so much so that if he saw them, he would turn away from him. They fled and were filled with terror. God Almighty said, “And you would think that they had awakened while they were asleep, and We would turn them over to the right and to the left, while their dog was spread out and spread out its arms in the battle. If you had seen them, you would have fled from them and would have been filled with terror from them.) And the young men had slept for those long years without food or drink, and yet they did not die, and none of them felt hungry or thirsty, and all of that was by God’s power (Almighty and Majestic). Days passed and years passed, and after this long period of time, God Almighty resurrected them from their sleep, and everything in this universe had changed. God resurrected them from their sleep, and they arose from their sleep feeling extremely tired in their bodies, and they began to ask among themselves how long they had stayed in the cave. God Almighty said, “Someone among them said, ‘How long did you tarry?’ They said, ‘We tarried a day.’” Or part of a day. They said, “Your Lord knows best how long you have remained,” thinking that time had not passed by for them and that the wheel of history was standing at their cave. One of them said: “One of them asks. It seems that they spent many hours asleep. So what do you think, O Rafa?” The second said: We may have stayed for a day, for this hunger that we feel and the fatigue that we feel announces what was announced. The third said: We have fallen asleep in the morning and the sun has not set, so I only think that we have stayed for part of a day. The fourth said: Leave your questioning, for God knows how long you have stayed, but I feel extreme hunger as if I have not eaten for several nights. So one of you should go to the city and prepare food for us, but it must be. Be careful so that no one knows him, because if they knew him and our position, they would kill us or tempt us from our religion. (So send one of you with this paper of yours to Medina, and let him see which of it has the purest food, and let him bring you provision from it, and let him be kind, and not (19) Indeed, if they defeat you, they will stone you or return you to their religion, and you will never prosper then.) So one of them went out looking for food, and in his hands were those silver coins that were engraved. On it is a picture of that unjust king who lived in that city and ruled it for more than three hundred years. When he walked in the streets of the city, he found that the A city whose features have all changed. The people are not the people, the roads are not the roads he knows, and the houses are not the houses. These are ruins that have become palaces, and those palaces have become ruins and ruins. These are faces he did not know and images he was not familiar with. As for the homes, they are like their homes. He saw men in the neighborhood other than his own. He began to think to himself: Have we gone to another country while we were sleeping, or has the earth rotated beneath us while we were not aware? His looks were puzzled and his gestures increased, and he appeared disturbed and bewildered until the people began to look. To him in astonishment and astonishment. One of them said to him: Are you a stranger to this country? What do you meditate on? What are you looking for? He said: I am not a stranger, but I am looking for food to buy, but I do not see where it is sold. The man took his hand until he ended up at a restaurant and asked the seller for food. The seller looked at him in amazement at his appearance. When he prepared the food for him and asked him for the price of the food, the young man gave him that money that had a picture of Daqianus on it. The seller was amazed and said to him, “Where did you get this money from?” The young man said: It is the money we deal with, and this is a picture of Daqianus. The seller said: Are you crazy? Daqianus - may God’s curse be upon him - died more than three hundred years ago. The young man was amazed as he heard these words and felt that the blood had frozen in his sweat. People gathered around this young man and people began to ask him: Did you find a treasure, boy? It is an old coin that has been around for more than three hundred years. The young man felt that the blood had stopped in his veins and said to them: O people, the matter is not as you think, and this money is not a treasure that I obtained. Rather, it is money that I took from my father yesterday with which I want to buy food today. So what makes you surprised?

Then they decided to return for fear that his matter would be exposed or the truth about his situation would become apparent, but they returned, so they accompanied him and spoke kindly to him and talked to him in conversation. And what was their greatest astonishment was when they learned that he was one of the noble young men who had fled for three hundred and nine years from their unjust and infidel king, and that they were the ones the king had wanted. He did not prevail over them and appealed to them, but he was not guided to them. And what was the greatest fear of the young man when he learned that they had become aware of his matter and knew his story. He feared for himself and his brothers while they were escaping. One of them said to them: Do not be afraid, this king whom you fear has been dead for about three hundred years, and the king who is sitting now believes in God as you believe. They took him to their king and asked him about his condition, so he informed him of his situation while he was confused about his condition and what he is in. So the king of the country and its people stood up until He led them to the cave and said to them: Let me enter before you so that I may inform my companions. So he entered, and it is said: They do not know how he went into it, and God concealed their news. It is said: Rather, they entered upon them and saw them. The king greeted them and embraced them, and he was a Muslim in what was said, so they were happy with him and they made him forget the words, then they said goodbye to him and greeted him and returned to their beds, and God Almighty took them away. They disagreed about them and disputed among themselves. What should they do with them? Among them were those who said: Build a building over them, their Lord knows best about them, but the rulers among them decided to build a mosque over them, and so it was as the mosque was built over them. This is a big mistake because the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, forbade Taking graves as mosques in which one prays. However, the greatest lesson in this beautiful story is that the dog who loved these young believers and kept them company was happy with their company until... God Almighty mentioned him in his book. If that dog was happy with the health of the people of faith, wouldn’t any of us be keen on the company of the people of faith and monotheism to be happy in this world and the hereafter?

number: قصة النملة مع سليمان عليه السلام
label:
قال الله تعالى : حَتَّىٰ إِذَا أَتَوْا عَلَىٰ وَادِ النَّمْلِ قَالَتْ نَمْلَةٌ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّمْلُ ادْخُلُوا مَسَاكِنَكُمْ لَا يَحْطِمَنَّكُمْ سُلَيْمَانُ وَجُنُودُهُ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ.

كان فى سالف الزمان نبى كريم أسمه سليمان بن داود عليه السلام وقف هذا النبى الكريم يوما ودعاه دعوه لم يدع بها نبى من قبله ولا بعده . وقف وقال : ( رب آغفر لى وهب لى ملكا لاينبغى لأحد من بعدى إنك أنت الوهاب ( 35 ) ) . فأعطاه الله ملكا لم يعطه لأحد من البشر وسخر له أشياء لم يسخرها لأحد من البشر . لقد علمه الله لغة الطيور والحيوانات وأعطاه من كل شئ .. وهو الذى اعترف بذلك فقال عليه السلام : ( يايها الناس علمنا منطق الطير وأوتينا من كل شئ ( 16 ) ) . أى من كل ما يحتاج الملك إليه من العدد والآلات والوجنود والجيوش والجماعات من الجن والأنس والطيور والوحوش والشاطين . وقد كان نبى الله سليمان عليه السلام عظيم الحكمة ، ولذلك يسميه أهل الكتاب (( سليملن الحكيم )) ولا يقلبونه بالنبى أصلا . قال مجاهد : ملك الدنيا أربعة : مؤمنان وكافران ، فأما المؤمنان : فسليمان بن داود وذو القرنين ، وأما الكافران : فالنمرود بن كنعان ، وبختصر .

بل إن الله عز وجل سخر له الريح تحمله من بلد إلى بلد آخر فى لمح البصر .. بل وتطيعه إذا أمرها . قال تعالى : ( ولسليمان الريح عاصفة تجرى بأمره إلى الأرض التى بركنا فيها ( 81 ) ) . وقال تعالى : ( ولسليمان الريح غدوها شهر ورواحها شهر ( 12 ) ) . لما ترك الخيل بتغاء وجه الله عوضه الله منها الريح التى هى أسرع سيرا وأقوى وأعظم ولا كلفة عليه لها قال تعالى : ( تجرى بأمره رخاء حيث أصاب ) ( 36 )) . أى : حيث أراد من أى البلاد ... كان له بساط مركب من أخشاب بحيث أنه سميع جميع ما يحتاج إليه من الدور المبينه والقصور والخيام والأمتعة والخيول والجمال والأثقال والرجال من الإنس والجن ، وغير ذلك من الحيوانات والطيور فإذا أراد سفرا أو مستنزها أو قتال ملك أوأعداء من أى بلاد الله شاء ، فإذا حمل هذه الأمور المذكورة على الباسط أمر الريح فدخلت تحته فرفعته فإذا استقل بين السماء والأرض أمر الخاء فسارت به ، فإذا أراد أسرع من ذلك أمر العاصفة فحملته أسرع فوضعته فى أى مكان شاء ، بحيث إنه كان يرتحل فى أول النهار من بيت المقدس فتغدو به الريح فتضعه بإصطخر مسيرة شهر فيقيم هناك إلى أخر النهار ، ثم يروح من آخره فترده إلى بيت المقدس .

بل وسخر الله عز وجل له الجن والشياطين لخدمته . قال تعالى : ( ومن الشيطين من يغوصون له ويعلمون عملا دون ذلك وكنا لهم حفظين ( 82 ) ) . وقال تعالى : والشيطين كل بناء وغواص ( 37 ) ) . أى : منهم ما هو مستعمل فى الأبنية الهائلة من محاريب وتماثيل وجفان كالجواب ، وقدروه راسيات إلى غير ذلك من الأعمال الشاقة ، التى لا يقدر عليها البشر ... وطائفة غواصون فى البحار ، يستخرجون ما فيها من اللألئ والجواهر والأشياء النفسية ، التى لا توجد إلا فيها قال تعالى : ( واءخرين مقرنين فى الأصفاد ( 38 ) ) . أى : موثوقون فى الأغلال والأكبال ، ممن قد تمرد وعصى وامتنع من العمل وأبى ، أو قد أساء فى صنيعة واعتدى . بل وأعطاه جيشا من الجن والإنس والطير . قال تعالى : ( وحشر لسليمن جنوده من الجن والإنس والطير ( 17 ) ) . وأتاه العلم والحكمة . فكان هذا كله ملك سليمان عليه السلام .

ن بسطت الي يدك لتقتلني ما أنا بباسط يدي إليك لاقتلك ....انى اخاف الله رب العالمين ... انى اريد ان تبوء بإثمى وإثمك فتكون من اصحاب النار وذلك جزاء الظالمين " ا انصرف هابيل مع زوجته إقليما .. تزوجا وعاشا أياما وقد ظهرت عليها إعراض الحمل في نفس الوقت كانت نفس قابيل طوعت له قتل أخيه استلقى هابيل على الأرض بعد عمل يوم شاق واستغرق فى النعاس انحدرت الشمس نحو الغرب وكان قد مات حمار فى الغابة فأكلت السباع لحمه وأكلت النسور ماتبقى منه وشربت الأرض دمه وبقى فكه العظمى ملقى على الأرض حمل قابيل أول سلاح في الأرض وراح يمضى باحثا عن شقيقه ووجده نائما استيقظ هابيل من نومه وفتح عينيه ارتفعت يد قابيل بالفك العظمى وهوت بسرعة انبثق الدم من وجه هابيل وملأ صدر قابيل عادت اليد الآثمة تهوى على الوجه الطيب وفى الضربة الخامسة ارتطمت يد قابيل بطين الحقل سكنت حركة هابيل وأيقن قابيل أن أخاه قد مات جلس واجما أمام ضحيته لا يعرف ماذا يفعل به ولا يعرف كيف يتصرف .

وفى يوم من الأيام خرجت تلك الجيوش والجماعات من الجن والإنس والطيور والوالحوش . خرجت كلها فى صفوف متنافسة ووقفوا جميعا ينتظرون خروج نبى الله سليمان عليه السلام . وبعد وقت قصير خرج سليمان عليه السلام ورأى هذه المملكه العظيمة فتذكر هذا الدعاء الجميل . ( رب آغفر لى وهب لى ملكا لا ينبغى لأحد من بعدى إنك أنت الوهاب ( 35 ) ) ... وكيف أن الله استجاب دعاءه وأعطاه ذلك الملك . نعم .. إنه يفهم لغة الطير ويحدثها ويأمرها فتطيع أمره ويأمر الريح أن تنقله فى أى وقت وإلى أى مكان فتطيع وتذهب من الشام إلى العراق فى الصباح وتعود به قبل الظهر . ويأمر الجن قيبنون له القصور ويصنعون له المحاريب والقدور الكبيرة . ومنهم من يغوص فى الأعماق ليأتوا إليه باللؤلؤ والكنوز والجواهر والأشياء النفسية . إنه ملك كبير وعظيم . أخذ سليمان عليه السلام ينظر إلى هذه الملك ويحمد الله حمدا كبيرا .

يا له من ملك عظيم لهذا النبى الكريم . نعم ... لقد سار سليمان عليه السلام مع هذا الجيش العسكرى الكبير الذى كان يتكون من ثلاث فرق : فرقة الإنس ، وفرقة الجن ، وفرقة الطير . وقال تعالى : ( وحشرر لسليمن جنوده من الجن والإنس والطير ( 17 ) ) . ولا يعنى هذا أن سليمان عليه السلام حكم كل الإنس ، وكل الجن ، وكل الطير ، وإنما حكم طوائف من الإنس تمثل عالم الإنس ، وطوائف من الجن تمثل عالم الجن ، وأصنافا من الطير تمثل عالم الطير . وكانت هذه الطوائف جنودا فى جيش سليمان عليه السلام . ورغم اختلاف أجناد الجيش ، وتنوع أصول الجنود ، إلا أنه كان جيشا منظما مرتبا متنافسا ، وكان الجنود من هذه الفرق يسيرون بنظام دقيق محكم ... وأشار إلى هذه التنظيم قوله تعالى : ( فهم ويزعون ( 17 ) ) .

نبى الله سليمان عليه السلام فى قرية النمل وفى هذا اليوم خرج سليمان عليه السلام وسط هذه الحشود العظيمة من الطير والإنس والجن فمروا على وادى النمل . فإذا به يسمع صوت نملة تقول للنمل من حولها قال تعالى : ( يأيها النمل آدخلوا مسكنكم لا يحطمنكم سليمن وجنوده وهم لا يشعرون ( 18 ) ) . لقد سار المركب موكب سلمان من الجن والإنس والطير فى ترتيب ونظام ، يجمع آخره على أوله ، تضم صفوفه ، وتتلاءم خطاه . حتى إذا أتوا على واد كثير النمل ، قالت نمله لها صفة الإشراف والتنظيم على النمل السارح فى الوادى – ومملكة النمل كمملكة النحل دقيقة التنظيم ، تتنوع فيها الوظائف ، وتؤدى كلها بنظام عجيب ، يعجب البشر غالبا عن اتباع مثله ، على ما أوتوا من عقل راق وإدراك عال – قالت هذه النمل للنمل ، بالوسيلة التى تتفاهم بها أمة النمل ، وباللغة المتعارفة بينها .. قالت للنمل قال تعالى : ( آدخلوا مسكنكم ( 18 ) ) . وعللت النملة الحكيمة طلبها ، بأنها فعلت ذلك لتحمى النمل من الهلاك تحت أقذدام جنود سليمان عليه السلام قال تعالى : ( لا يحطمنكم سليمن وجنوده ( 18 ) ) . أى : إذا بقيتم أيها النمل تتحركون عى وجه الأرض فسوف يحطمنكم سليمان وجنوده ، فادخلوا بيوتكم أماكن سكنكم لئلا تحطموا وتدمروا . وحتى لا تسئ أمتها من النمل الظن بسليمان عليه السلام وجنوده المؤمنين ، استدركت النملة الحكيمة قائلة قال تعالى : ( وهم لا يشعرون ( 18 ) ) . وهذه الأية الاستدراكية منها للاعتذار ، تعتذر لقومها عن أى أذى يصيبهم من سليمان وجنوده ، وتبين أن سليمان وجنوده ما كانوا يريدون إيذاع النمل ولا تحطيمها ، فإذا داسوها بأقدامهم فلأنهم لم يشعروا بها . وهذا يدل على حرص النملة الحكيمة على الإعتذار عم ما قد يصدر عن سليمان وجنوده ، وحرصها على تبرئة سليمان النبى عليه السلام من أى تهمة قد توجهها النمل به . كما يدل كلام النملة على حرصها على أمتها من النمل ، وإشفاقها عليهم ، واهتمامها بهم ، وتفكيرها فى تخليصهم من الخطر ، وإيصالهم إلى بر الأمان . فإذا كانت نملة صغيرة بهذا الإهتمام بالنمل ، وهى حشرة زاحفة صغيرة لا تكاد ترى ... فلماذا لا يكون البشر ذوو العقل والأفهام مهتمين بالناس ، حريصون على نصحهم وإبعاد الحظر إليهم ؟ وعندما كلمت النملة أمهتا بهذه النصيحة ، واستمع النمل لها ، واستجاب لها ، وسارع النمل إلى دخوله مساكنه والاحتماء من الخطر فى بيويته .

سليمان عليه السلام يتبسم ضاحكا من قوله النملة ولم سمع جنود سليمان كلام النملة لأمتها ... لكن سليمان عليه السلام سمع كلامها ، وفهم مرادها ، وتأثر بنطقها ، لأن الله علمه منطق الطيور والحيوانات والحشرات . ولما سمع ذلك : (( تبسم ضاحكا من قولها )) . ولما تبسم ضاحكا من قول النملة معجبا مستحسنا توجه إلى الله بالحمد والشكر والتضرع والدعاء ( رب أوزعنى أن أشكر نعمتك التى أنعمت على وعلى ولدى وأن أعمل صلحا ترضه وآدخلنى برحمتك فى عبادك الصلحين ) . ووقف سليمان عليه السلام هو وجنوده حتى دخل جيش النمل إلى مساكنه ثم بدأ بعد ذلك فى التحرك ليكمل رحلته هو وجنوده .
number-en: The story of the ant with Solomon, peace be upon him
label-en:
God Almighty said: Until, when they came to the Valley of the Ants, an ant said, “O ants, enter your dwellings, lest Solomon and his soldiers crush you while they were They don't feel it.

Once upon a time, there was a noble prophet whose name was Suleiman bin Dawood, peace be upon him. This noble prophet stood up one day and prayed a supplication that no prophet before him or after him had ever prayed. He stood up and said: (My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom that no one after me should have. You are the Giver (35)). So God gave him a kingdom that he had not given to any human being, and He subjected to him things that he had not subjected to any human being. God taught him the language of birds and animals and gave him everything.. And he was the one who acknowledged that, so he said, peace be upon him: (O people, we have been taught the language of birds and we have been given everything (16)). That is, from everything that the king needs in terms of numbers, machines, soldiers, armies, and groups of jinn, humans, birds, beasts, and devils. The Prophet of God, Solomon, peace be upon him, was of great wisdom, and that is why the People of the Book call him “Solomon the Wise” and do not consider him a prophet at all. Mujahid said: There are four kings of the world: two believers and two unbelievers. As for the two believers: Suleiman bin Dawud and Dhul-Qarnayn, and as for the two unbelievers: Nimrod bin Kanaan, in short.

In fact, God Almighty subjected the wind to him, which carried him from one country to another in the blink of an eye... and even obeyed him if he commanded it. God Almighty said: (And for Solomon the wind was a storm, flowing at his command to the land in which We established (81)). And God Almighty said: (And for Solomon the wind, its beginning was a month and its rest was a month (12)). When he left the horses seeking the face of God, God compensated him with the wind that was faster, stronger, and greater, and there was no cost to him for it. God Almighty said: (Prosperity flows by His command wherever it strikes) (36)). That is: wherever he wanted from any country... he had a rug made of wood so that he could hear everything he needed from clear houses, palaces, tents, luggage, horses, camels, burdens, men from humans and jinn, and other animals and birds. So if he wanted to travel, or camp, or fight a king or enemies from any country God wanted, So if he carried these mentioned matters on the Basit, he commanded the wind and it entered under him and raised him, and if he was independent between the sky and the earth, he commanded the Kha, and it moved with it. If he wanted faster than that, he commanded the storm, so it carried him faster and placed him in any place he wanted, such that he would travel at the beginning of the day from Bayt al-Maqdis, and the wind would come with him and place him in Istakhar, a month’s journey, and he would stay there until the end of the day, and then he would depart at the end of the day and it would return him to Bayt al-Maqdis.

Indeed, God Almighty subjected the jinn and devils to his service. God Almighty said: (And among the devils are those who delve into Him and teach work other than that, and We are their guardians (82)). And God Almighty said: And the two devils are every builder and diver (37). That is to say: some of them are used in huge buildings, such as niches, statues, and shrines like doors, and they are anchored and other hard work, which humans are not capable of... And a group of divers in the seas, extracting what is in it of pearls, jewels, and psychological things, which are not found except in it. God Almighty said: (And others bound in shackles (38)). That is, those who are trusted in shackles and shackles, from those who have rebelled, disobeyed, refrained from working and refused, or have done wrong in their actions and transgressed. Rather, he gave him an army of jinn, humans, and birds. God Almighty said: (And gathered for Solomon were his hosts of jinn, mankind, and birds (17)). Knowledge and wisdom came to him. This was all the property of Solomon, peace be upon him.

If you extend your hand to me to kill me, I will not extend my hand to you to kill you.... Indeed, I fear God, Lord of the worlds... I want you to bear my sin and your sin, so that you will be among the inmates of the Fire, and that is the recompense of the wrongdoers.” Abel departed with his wife in peace.. They got married and lived for several days, and symptoms of pregnancy appeared at the same time. Cain's soul volunteered to kill his brother. Abel lay down on the ground after a hard day's work and fell asleep. The sun descended toward the west, and a donkey had died in the forest. The wild lions ate his flesh, the eagles ate what was left of him, and the ground drank his blood, and his great jaw remained lying on the ground. Cain picked up the first weapon in the ground and went looking for his brother and found him asleep. Abel woke up from He fell asleep and opened his eyes. Cain's great hand rose with his jaw and fell quickly. Blood gushed out from Abel's face and filled Cain's chest. The sinful hand returned to falling upon the good face. In the fifth blow, Cain's hand hit the mud of the field. Abel's movement stopped, and Cain was certain that his brother was dead. He sat helpless in front of his victim, not knowing what to do with him and not knowing how to act.

One day, those armies and groups of jinn, humans, birds, and animals emerged. They all went out in competing ranks and they all stood waiting for the Prophet of God, Solomon, peace be upon him, to emerge. After a short time, Solomon, peace be upon him, went out and saw this great kingdom, so he remembered this beautiful supplication. (My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom that no one will have after me. You are the Giver (35))... And how God answered his prayer and gave him that kingdom. Yes.. He understands the language of birds, speaks to it, and commands it, so it obeys his command. He commands the wind to transport it at any time and to any place, so it obeys, and it goes from the Levant to Iraq in the morning and returns with it before noon. He orders the jinn to build palaces for him and make niches and large pots for him. Some of them dive into the depths to bring back pearls, treasures, gems, and psychological things. He is a big and mighty king. Solomon, peace be upon him, looked at this queen and thanked God greatly.

What a great king this noble prophet is. Yes ... Solomon, peace be upon him, marched with this large military army, which consisted of three divisions: the human division, the jinn division, and the bird division. And God Almighty said: (And gathered for Solomon his armies of the jinn, mankind, and birds (17)). This does not mean that Solomon, peace be upon him, ruled over all humans, all jinn, and all birds. Rather, he ruled over groups of humans representing the world of humans, groups of jinn representing the world of jinn, and types of birds representing the world of birds. These sects were soldiers in the army of Solomon, peace be upon him. Despite the differences in the ranks of the army, and the diversity of the origins of the soldiers, it was an organized, organized, and competing army, and the soldiers from these divisions were marching in a precise and precise order... This organization was referred to in the Almighty’s saying: (They understand and they disperse (17)).

The Prophet of God, Solomon, peace be upon him, in the village of ants. On this day, Solomon, peace be upon him, went out among these great crowds of birds, humans, and jinn, so they passed by the valley of ants. Then he heard the voice of an ant saying to the ants around it: God Almighty said: (O ants, enter your dwelling, lest Solomon and his soldiers destroy you while they do not perceive it (18)). The boat was accompanied by Salman’s procession of jinn, humans, and birds in order and order, with its end united over its beginning, its ranks united, and its steps consistent. Until, when they came to a valley full of ants, an ant said it had the capacity to supervise and organize the ants roaming in the valley - and the ant kingdom is like the kingdom of bees, carefully organized, in which the functions are diverse, and all of them are performed by a strange system, the like of which humans often refuse to follow, despite the sophisticated mind and high understanding they are endowed with - these ants said to the ants, by the means by which the nation of ants communicates, and in the language known to them.. She said to the ants: God Almighty said: (Enter your dwelling (18)). The wise ant justified her request by saying that she did so to protect the ants from destruction under the feet of the soldiers of Solomon, peace be upon him. God Almighty said: (Do not destroy you Solomon and his soldiers (18)). That is: If you, ants, continue moving on the face of the earth, Solomon and his soldiers will destroy you, so enter your homes, the places you live, lest you be destroyed and destroyed. And so that her nation of ants would not have bad thoughts about Solomon, peace be upon him, and his faithful soldiers, the wise ant responded by saying: God Almighty said: (And they perceive not (18)). This supplementary verse is an apology, apologizing to her people for any harm that befell them from Solomon and his soldiers, and it clarifies that Solomon and his soldiers did not want to scatter the ants or destroy them, so if they trampled them with their feet, it was because they did not feel them. This indicates the wise ant’s keenness to apologize for what might come from Solomon and his soldiers, and its keenness to acquit Solomon the Prophet, peace be upon him, of any accusation the ant might bring against him. The ant’s words also indicate her concern for her nation of ants, her compassion for them, her concern for them, and her thinking about ridding them of danger and bringing them to safety. If a small ant is so interested in ants, which are a small crawling insect that you can hardly see... why are not humans with reason and understanding interested in people, keen to advise them and remove prohibitions from them? When the ant spoke to its mother with this advice, the ants listened to her and responded to her, and the ants quickly entered their homes and took shelter from danger in their homes.

Solomon, peace be upon him, smiled and laughed at what the ant said, and Solomon’s soldiers did not hear the ant’s words to her nation... But Solomon, peace be upon him, heard her words, understood what she meant, and was affected by her pronunciation, because God taught him the logic of birds, animals, and insects. When he heard that, he smiled and laughed at what she said. And when he smiled and laughed at the ant’s words with admiration and approval, he turned to God with praise, thanks, supplication, and supplication (My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your blessings which You have bestowed upon me and upon my children, and to do righteousness that pleases You, and admit me, by Your mercy, into the ranks of Your righteous servants). Solomon, peace be upon him, stood with his soldiers until the army of ants entered his dwellings, and then he began to move to continue his journey with his soldiers.

number: قصة الهدهد مع سليمان عليه السلام
label:
قال الله تعالى : ﴿وَتَفَقَّدَ الطَّيْرَ فَقَالَ مَا لِيَ لا أَرَى الْهُدْهُدَ أَمْ كَانَ مِنَ الْغَائِبِينَ * لأُعَذِّبَنَّهُ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا أَوْ لأَذْبَحَنَّهُ أَوْ لَيَأْتِيَنِّي بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ﴾

أكرمَ اللهُ عزَّ وجلَّ عبدَهُ ونبيَّهُ سليمانَ عليهِ السلامُ بنعَمٍ كثيرةٍ وخَصّهُ بمزايا رائعةً كانتْ عُنوانًا للعَظَمَةِ والمجدِ ومَظْهرًا من مظاهِرِ المُلْكِ العظيمِ والجاهِ الكبيرِ والدرجةِ العاليةِ عندَ اللهِ سبحانَهُ، فقدْ فضّلَهُ اللهُ تعالى بالنبُوّةِ وتسخيرِ الشياطينِ والجنِّ والطيرِ وقدْ علّمَهُ اللهُ تعالى مَنْطِقَ الطّيرِ ولُغتَهُ وسائرَ لغاتِ الحيواناتِ فكانَ يفهمُ عنْها ما لا يفهمُهُ سائرُ الناسِ وكانَ يتحدّثُ معها أحيانًا كما كانَ الأمرُ مع الهُدْهُدِ والنّملِ.

وكانتْ وظيفةُ الهُدْهُدِ في جيشِ سيّدِنا سليمانَ أنّهم كانوا إذا أعوزوا الماءَ واحتاجوا إليهِ في حالِ الأسفارِ أنْ يجيءَ الهُدْهُدُ فينظرَ لهم هلْ بهذهِ البقاعِ مَنْ ماءٍ ؟ لأنّ الهُدْهُدَ كانَ ينظرُ إلى الماءِ تحتَ تُخومِ الأرضِ ، كانَ يرَى الماءَ في الأرضِ كما يرى الماءَ في الزّجاجَةِ بمشيئةِ اللهِ تعالى. فلقدْ ذَكَرَ المفسّرونَ أنّ سليمانَ لما حَجّ خرَجَ إلى اليمنِ فوافى صنعاءَ وقتَ الزّوالِ فنَزَلَ ليصلّي فلمْ يجدِ الماءَ فتفقّدَهُ لذلكَ .

وذُكِرَ أيضًا أنّه وقعتْ نفحةٌ منَ الشمسِ على رأسِ سيِّدِنا سليمانَ فنظرَ فإذا موضعُ الهُدْهُدِ خالٍ ، لأنّ الطّيرَ كانتْ تُظِلّ سليمانَ عليهِ السلامُ منْ أشعّةِ الشّمسِ . فلمّا فقدَ الهُدْهُدَ دعا عريفَ الطّيرِ وهو النَّسْرُ فسألَهُ عنهُ فلمْ يجدْ عندَهُ عِلْمَهُ ، ثمّ قالَ لسيّدِ الطّيرِ وهوَ العُقابُ: "عليَّ بهِ" فارتفعَ العُقابُ فنظرَ فرأى الهُدْهُدَ مُقبِلاً منْ بعيدٍ فقصدَهُ فقالَ لهُ الهُدْهُدُ: "ناشدتُكَ اللهَ أنْ تتْرُكَني" فتركَهُ ووصلَ الهُدْهُدُ إلى سيِّدِنا سليمانَ فلمّا قَرُبَ منهُ أرْخَى ذنبَهُ وجناحيْهِ يجرُّهُما على الأرضِ وقال: "يا نبيَّ اللهِ اذكُرْ وقوفَكَ بينَ يديِ اللهِ" .(أيْ في موقفِ يومِ القيامةِ، وليس معنى ذلك أنّ الله موضوفٌ باليدِ الجارحةِ لأنه منَزّهٌ عن ذلك وموجودٌ بلا مكانٍ) فارتعَدَ سليمانُ وعفا عنهُ. يقولُ ربُّ العِزّةِ في مُحكَمِ التّنْزيلِ: ﴿وَتَفَقَّدَ الطَّيْرَ فَقَالَ مَا لِيَ لا أَرَى الْهُدْهُدَ أَمْ كَانَ مِنَ الْغَائِبِينَ * لأُعَذِّبَنَّهُ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا أَوْ لأَذْبَحَنَّهُ أَوْ لَيَأْتِيَنِّي بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ﴾ سورة النمل/20-21 .

قالَ أوْ لأذبحنَّهُ أوْ ليأتيَني بسلطانٍ مبينٍ أي بحُجّةٍ لهُ فيها عُذرٌ ظاهرٌ على غيبتِه. فلمّا سألَهُ عنْ غَيْبَتِهِ أخبرَهُ بأنّهُ اطّلَعَ على ما لَمْ يطّلِعْ عليهِ وأخبرَهُ بخبرٍ يقينٍ صادقٍ وهوُ أنّهُ كانَ في اليمنِ في بلدَةِ سبَإٍ وأنّ هناكَ مَلِكَةً على هذهِ البلادِ تُدعى بلقيسَ قدْ ملَكَتْ على تلكَ الأمّةِ في اليمنِ وأوتيَتْ منْ كلِّ شىءٍ يُعطاهُ المُلوكُ ويؤتاهُ النّاسُ ولها عرشٌ عظيمٌ مزخرفٌ بأنواعِ الزِّينةِ والجواهرِ مِمّا يُبهِرُ العيونَ. يقولُ اللهُ تعالى: ﴿فَمَكَثَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ فَقَالَ أَحَطتُ بِمَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِ وَجِئْتُكَ مِن سَبَإٍ بِنَبَإٍ يَقِينٍ * إِنِّي وَجَدتُ امْرَأَةً تَمْلِكُهُمْ وَأُوتِيَتْ مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍ وَلَهَا عَرْشٌ عَظِيمٌ * وَجَدتُهَا وَقَوْمَهَا يَسْجُدُونَ لِلشَّمْسِ مِن دُونِ اللهِ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الشَّيْطَانُ أَعْمَالَهُمْ فَصَدَّهُمْ عَنِ السَّبِيلِ فَهُمْ لا يَهْتَدُونَ * أَلاَّ يَسْجُدُوا للهِ الَّذِي يُخْرِجُ الْخَبْءَ فِي السَّمَوَاتِ وَالأَرْضِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُخْفُونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ * اللهُ لا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ﴾ سورةُ النملِ/22-23-24-25-26 .

أَلاَّ يَسْجُدُوا للهِ الَّذِي يُخْرِجُ الْخَبْءَ فِي السَّمَوَاتِ وَالأَرْضِ، وخَبْءُ السّماءِ المطرُ، وخَبْءُ الأرضِ النباتُ. وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُخْفُونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ ، فلمّا فَرَغَ الهُدْهُدُ منْ كلامِهِ قالَ سليمانُ عليهِ السلامُ: "سننظُرُ أصدَقْتَ (أي فيما أخبَرْتَ عن خبر بلقيس) أمْ كنتَ منَ الكاذبينَ ؟"

ثمّ كتبَ سليمانُ كتابًا: "منْ عبدِ اللهِ سليمانَ بنَ داودَ إلى بلقيسَ ملكةِ سبَإٍ بسمِ اللهِ الرحمنِ الرحيمِ السلامُ على مَنِ اتّبعِ الهُدى أمّا بعدُ فلا تعلُو عَلَيّ وأتوني مسلمينَ" وطَبَعَهُ بالمِسكِ وختمَهُ بخاتَمِهِ وقالَ للهُدْهُدِ: "اذهبْ بكتابي هذا فألْقِهِ إليهِمْ " أيْ إلى بَلقيسَ وقومِها، فأخَذَ الهُدْهُدُ الكتابَ بمِنقارِهِ ودخلَ عليها مِنْ كُوّةٍ فطَرَحَ الكتابَ على نَمْرِها وهي راقدةٌ وتوارى في الكَوَّةِ فانتبَهَتْ فَزِعَةً ، يقولُ اللهُ تعالى في القرءانِ العظيمِ إخبارًا عنْ بلقيسَ : ﴿قَالَتْ يَا أَيُّهَا المَلأُ إِنِّي أُلْقِيَ إِلَيَّ كِتَابٌ كَرِيمٌ إِنَّهُ مِن سُلَيْمَانَ وَإِنَّهُ بِسْمِ اللهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَلاَّ تَعْلُوا عَلَيَّ وَأْتُونِي مُسْلِمِينَ﴾ النمل/29-30-31 .
number-en: The story of the hoopoe with Solomon, peace be upon him
label-en:
God Almighty said: “And he inspected the birds and said, ‘What is the matter with me that I do not see the hoopoe? Or is it one of those who are absent? To bring me clear authority.

God Almighty honored His servant and Prophet Solomon, peace be upon him, with many blessings and bestowed upon him wonderful advantages that were a symbol of greatness and glory and a manifestation of great kingship, great prestige, and a high rank in the eyes of God, Glory be to Him. God Almighty favored him with prophecy and the subjugation of devils, jinn, and birds. God Almighty taught him the logic of birds, their language, and all the languages ​​of animals, so he understood about them what other people did not understand, and he would sometimes talk to them, as was the case with the hoopoe and the ants. The job of the hoopoe in the army of our Master Solomon was that if they were in short supply of water and needed it while traveling, the hoopoe would come and check for them whether there was any water in these places? Because the hoopoe looked at the water under the borders of the earth. He saw the water in the earth just as he saw the water in a bottle, by the will of God Almighty. The commentators mentioned that when Solomon performed Hajj, he went out to Yemen and arrived in Sana’a at noon time. He went down to pray and did not find water, so he checked it for that reason.

It was also reported that a ray of sun fell on the head of our Master Solomon, and he looked and saw that the hoopoe’s place was empty, because the birds were providing shade for Solomon, peace be upon him, from the rays of the sun. When the hoopoe was missing, he called the master of the bird, which is the eagle, and asked him about him, but he did not find his knowledge with him. Then he said to the master of the bird, which is the eagle: “I will take care of it.” The eagle rose and looked and saw the hoopoe coming from afar, so he went to him and said to him. The hoopoe: “I called upon God to leave me.” So he left him, and the hoopoe reached our master Solomon. When he approached him, he relaxed his tail and his wings, dragging them along the ground, and said: “O Prophet of God, remember your standing before God.” (i.e., in a position on the day of Resurrection, This does not mean that God is attacked by a cruel hand, because He is above that and exists without a place.) So Solomon trembled and pardoned him. The Lord of Glory says in the decisive revelation: “And he inspected the bird and said, ‘What is the matter with me that I do not see the hoopoe? Or is it among those who are absent? We would have slaughtered it or it would have come to me with clear authority.” Surat An-Naml: 20-21.

He said, "I will slaughter him, or he will bring me clear evidence," that is, a proof for which he has an apparent excuse for his absence. When he asked him about his absence, he told him that he had seen what he had not seen, and he told him certain and true news, which is that he was in Yemen in the town of Sheba, and that there was a queen in this country called Bilqis, who ruled over that nation in Yemen and was given Of everything that is given to kings and given to people, and it has a great throne decorated with all kinds of adornments and jewels that dazzle the eyes. God Almighty says: “Then he remained not long and said: I have encompassed what you have not encompassed, and I have come to you from Sheba with certain news. * Indeed, I have found a woman ruling over them, and I have been given Of everything, and she has a great throne. * I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of God, and Satan made their deeds pleasing to them, and turned them from the path. So they are not guided * Do they not prostrate to God, who brings forth what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and He knows what you hide and what you declare * God There is no god but He, Lord of the Great Throne. (Surat An-Naml: 22-23-24-25-26)

Do they not prostrate themselves to God who brings forth what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and what is hidden in the sky is rain, and what is hidden in the earth is vegetation. And He knows what you hide and what you declare, When the hoopoe finished speaking, Solomon, peace be upon him, said: “We will see whether you told the truth (that is, in what you reported about the news of Bilqis) or whether you were one of the liars?”

Then Solomon wrote a letter: “From Abdullah Suleiman, son of David, to Bilqis, Queen of Sheba. In the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Peace be upon whoever follows guidance. As for now, do not be superior to me and come to me in submission.” He printed it with musk and sealed it with his seal and said to the hoopoe: “Go with this letter of mine and deliver it to them,” that is, to Bilqis and her people. Then the hoopoe took the book in its beak and entered upon her through a window. He threw the book on her tiger while she was lying down and hid in the window. Then she woke up in horror. God Almighty says in the Great Qur’an about Bilqis: “She said, ‘O you!’” “Indeed, a noble letter has been delivered to me. It is from Solomon, and it is in the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. ‘Do not be arrogant against me and come to me in submission.’” An-Naml/29-30-31.
